remarks: If from the proposition that ` x ` has property ` A ` it can be inferred generally, whatever ` x ` may be, that every result of an application of the procedure ` R ` to ` x ` has property ` A ` , then we say " Property ` A ` is hereditary in the ` R ` -sequence.  Definition 69 of [Frege1879] p. 55.  (Contributed by RP, 28-Mar-2020.)
statement:
dffrege69 $p |- ( A. x ( x e. A -> A. y ( x R y -> y e. A ) ) <-> R hereditary A ) $.
$d A x y $.
$d R x y $.
